name: pytensor
summary: Optimizing compiler for evaluating mathematical expressions on CPUs and GPUs.

chunks.text:
.. image:: https://cdn.rawgit.com/pymc-devs/pytensor/main/doc/images/PyTensor_RGB.svg

Tests Status

Project Name
efficiently evaluate mathematical expressions involving multi-dimensional arrays.
It provides the computational backend for `PyMC `__.

Features
========

- A hackable, pure-Python codebase
- Extensible graph framework suitable for rapid development of custom operators and symbolic optimizations
- Implements an extensible graph transpilation framework that currently provides
  compilation via C, `JAX `__, and `Numba `__
- Contrary to PyTorch and TensorFlow, PyTensor maintains a static graph which can be modified in-place to
  allow for advanced optimizations

Getting started
===============

.. code-block:: python

See `the PyTensor documentation `__ for in-depth tutorials.

Background
==========

PyTensor is a fork of `Aesara `__, which is a fork of `Theano `__.

Contributing
============

We welcome bug reports and fixes and improvements to the documentation.

For more information on contributing, please see the
`contributing guide `__.

A good place to start contributing is by looking through the issues
`here `__.

usage_description:
Here is a short (2-sentence) summary of what a developer can achieve with this library:

This library, PyTensor, is used to efficiently evaluate mathematical expressions involving multi-dimensional arrays on CPUs and GPUs. With its extensible graph framework and transpilation capabilities, developers can optimize complex computations and leverage the power of various backend technologies like C, JAX, and Numba.
